com.yahoo.sketches.memory

Class MemoryRegion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.sketches.memory.MemoryRegion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Memory

    public class MemoryRegion
extends Object
implements Memory
    The MemoryRegion class implements the Memory interface and provides a means of hierarchically partitioning a large block of native memory into smaller regions of memory, each with their own capacity and offsets.

    If asserts are enabled in the JVM, the methods in this class perform bounds checking against the region's defined boundaries and then redirect the call to the parent Memory class. If the parent class is also a MemoryRegion it does a similar check and then calls its parent. The root of this hierarchy will be a NativeMemory class that ultimately performs the desired task. If asserts are not enabled the JIT compiler will eliminate all the asserts and the hierarchical calls should collapse to a call to the NativeMemory method.

    Because asserts must be specifically enabled in the JVM, it is incumbent on the user of this class to make sure that their code is thoroughly tested. Violating memory bounds can cause memory segment faults, which takes down the JVM and can be very difficult to debug.

    Author:
    Lee Rhodes
    See Also:
    NativeMemory

      • MemoryRegion

        public MemoryRegion(Memory memory,
                    long memOffsetBytes,
                    long capacityBytes)
        Defines a region of the given parent Memory by defining an offset and capacity that are within the boundaries of the parent.
        Parameters:
        memory - the parent Memory
        memOffsetBytes - the starting offset in bytes of this region with respect to the start of the parent memory.
        capacityBytes - the capacity in bytes of this region.

      • MemoryRegion

        public MemoryRegion(Memory memory,
                    long memOffsetBytes,
                    long capacityBytes,
                    MemoryRequest memReq)
        Defines a region of the given parent Memory by defining an offset and capacity that are within the boundaries of the parent.
        Parameters:
        memory - the parent Memory
        memOffsetBytes - the starting offset in bytes of this region with respect to the start of the parent memory.
        capacityBytes - the capacity in bytes of this region.
        memReq - a MemoryRequest object

        Copies bytes from a source region of this Memory to a destination region of this Memory. These regions may not overlap. This will be checked if asserts are enabled in the JVM.
